intro: Lathrophytum peckoltii, commonly known as the Peckoltii lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that produces clusters of flowers on tall, slender stems, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by gardeners interested in exotic and drought-tolerant plants.
